did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: First Presbyterian Church of Seneca Falls records, 1802-1879.

origination.label: Creator:
origination.corpname: First Presbyterian Church of Seneca Falls (Seneca Falls, N.Y.)

did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Four volumes which include session meeting minutes (1808-1830, 1830-1838, 1838-1850, 1851-1879); the Church Covenant and Confession of Faith; lists of members, baptisms and deaths; and annual statistical reports to the Presbytery. There were revivals in the church in 1830-1831, 1858-1859, in the 1860's and 1870's and in 1877-1878.

bioghist.head: ORGANIZATIONAL HISTORY
bioghist.p: On August 10, 1807 the First Presbyterian Church of Junius was formed by the Reverend Jedediah Chapman of Geneva when seventeen members elected deacons and elders and signed a covenant. By 1817 the society was able to build a meeting house, which it sold in 1842 to allow for the construction of a new brick meeting house on the same site. In 1871 this meeting house was torn down and a large gothic church was built. There were revivals in the church in 1830-1831, 1858-1859, in the 1860's and 1870's and in 1877-1878.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Four volumes which include session meeting minutes (1808-1830, 1830-1838, 1838-1850, 1851-1879); the Church Covenant and Confession of Faith; lists of members, baptisms and deaths; and annual statistical reports to the Presbytery. There were revivals in the church in 1830-1831, 1858-1859, in the 1860's and 1870's and in 1877-1878.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use:
userestrict.p: Not to be published or otherwise released in such form that any individual mentioned in the records can be identified.
